sections.heading: by confession; contents.The debt or cause of action shall be briefly stated in the judgment, or in a writing to be filed as pleadings in other actions
sections.text: SourceR.S.1867, Code § 434, p. 466;R.S.1913, § 8003;C.S.1922, § 8944;C.S.1929, § 20-1310;R.S.1943, § 25-1310.AnnotationsThe provisions of this sectio

25-1310.Judgment by confession; contents.

The debt or cause of action shall be briefly stated in the judgment, or in a writing to be filed as pleadings in other actions.

SourceR.S.1867, Code § 434, p. 466;R.S.1913, § 8003;C.S.1922, § 8944;C.S.1929, § 20-1310;R.S.1943, § 25-1310.

Annotations

The provisions of this section are applicable to only civil proceedings. Dunham v. O'Grady, 137 Neb. 649, 290 N.W. 723 (1940).
